image.altText: Screenshots from iPhone videos, one shows a worker walking through mud, the other shows heavy machinery.

props.synopsis: Workers say they are being exposed to dangerous conditions on solar farms, including working near live cables in wet weather or being put at risk of electrocution.

title.children: 'I knew something wasn't right': Workers sound alarm about unsafe conditions on solar farms

image.altText: A black and white photo of planes flying over jungle.

props.synopsis: Almost eight decades after their aircraft crashed in waters south of Papua New Guinea, Australian crew members have been identified, as Twiggy Forrest searches for his late wartime relative.

title.children: Bone fragments in PNG underwater wreck identified as Australian WWII crew

image.altText: A worker wearing a face mask works on a production line manufacturing bicycle steel rims in China.

props.synopsis: The prime minister sees an agenda to grow local green manufacturing as not only economically and strategically vital, but a political no-brainer. But that's only if it all works.

title.children: Albanese says the way we structure our economies is changing. But can Australia really keep up with China?

image.altText: A woman holding photos of her three children.

props.synopsis: In Japan, thousands of children are cut off from their mum or dad every year as victims of a system that incentivises parental child abduction. The country will soon introduce laws that will enforce joint custody, but it's only caused more division.

title.children: 'Love you no matter what': Izumi's kids were photographed calling for her death, but she won't stop fighting for them

image.altText: On right a woman covers her face as she walks out of court, on left an old man speaks as a young woman listens

props.synopsis: In the final months of the 2020 presidential election, a Florida woman found herself holding what she thought could be the answer to her financial problems – Ashley Biden's diary.

title.children: In the last days of the 2020 US election, a 'despicable' plot unfolded to expose a diary by Joe Biden's daughter

image.altText: Lindsey Graham speaks at a podium while Donald Trump watches from behind.

props.synopsis: The former president hoped his abortion video would take the issue "out of play" before November's US election, but even some of his allies are determined not to let that happen.

title.children: Trump's anger at an ally has highlighted one of his big election fears

image.altText: A man in framless glasses, wearing a black tracksuit and facemask arrives in court flanked by officers

props.synopsis: Allen Weisselberg has pleaded guilty to lying to investigators and a judge about his involvement in determining the value of Donald Trump's Manhattan townhouse.

title.children: Former financial officer for Donald Trump's property empire jailed for lying in fraud cause

image.altText: A number of adults in protective headgear, surround a boy in a padded room preparing to grab him. All faces are blurred.

props.synopsis: A damning review finds the NDIS Quality and Safeguards Commission failed to close a controversial program that put children with disabilities at risk of death despite reports from officials and families that it was using prohibited restraints.

title.children: Former judge criticises NDIS commission's response to controversial autism program

image.altText: Hamas Chief Ismail Haniyeh points as he makes a speech in Gaza.

props.synopsis: Three sons of Hamas' top political leader Ismail Haniyeh have been killed by an Israeli air strike in the Gaza Strip.

title.children: Hamas leader accuses Israel of killing his sons in 'spirit of revenge and murder' in Gaza

image.altText: A man in a pink shirt with a laptop looking unimpressed

props.synopsis: Andrew Ryder's rainy-day bank account was drained in just one day. It happened via phone porting and SIM-swap fraud, but the veteran has no idea how scammers had his data in the first place.

title.children: Man's digital identity trashed and bank account drained after fraudsters steal phone number

image.altText: Baby in hospital bed with tubes in nose

props.synopsis: Parts of Queensland have already experienced far higher numbers of of flu, RSV, and COVID respiratory infections when compared to the same time last year, and whooping cough's three to four-yearly cycle is emerging nationally.

title.children: Triple whammy of viruses, whooping cough adds pressure to early onset of flu season

image.altText: Penny Wong sits with her arms crossed in the Senate

props.synopsis: In floating the possibility of Australia recognising a Palestinian state, Penny Wong said the quiet thing out loud and in doing so tore open one of the most sensitive decades-old debates.

title.children: Wong planned to say the quiet thing out loud. Her critics were quick to pounce

image.altText: Side profile of bald man wearing glasses speaking.

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton accuses the government of "a clear prejudice towards Israel" after Foreign Minister Penny Wong reiterated support for a two-state solution.

title.children: Dutton accuses Wong of 'most reckless act' in decades over Israeli-Palestinian two-state solution calls

image.altText: A TV reporter stands holding a microphone with "7" on it, next to a swimming pool at the Tokyo Olympics.

props.synopsis: AOC president Ian Chesterton and colleagues and friends from multiple networks pay tribute to former Sunrise and Olympics reporter Nathan Templeton after his death at the age of 44.

title.children: Tributes flow after former Channel Seven Sunrise and Olympics reporter Nathan Templeton dies at 44

image.altText: Hundreds of Muslims outside Lakemba mosque, with the Palestinian flag flying on the front gate.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Muslims gather at Sydney's Lakemba Mosque for the morning Eid prayer, with not a single politician in sight — because none were invited.

title.children: One of Australia's biggest mosques breaks tradition by not inviting any MPs to annual Eid prayer

image.altText: Anthony Albanese at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese wants to funnel taxpayer-funded incentives towards advanced manufacturing and clean energy projects, as Australia tries to compete with US President Joe Biden's massive spending plans.

title.children: PM says public funds should fuel clean energy and tech investment

image.altText: Fatal stabbing victim William Holdback.

props.synopsis: Police investigating the fatal stabbing of 21-year-old William Holdback, whose body was found in a suburban Adelaide street early this morning, are searching for a car captured on CCTV.

title.children: Fatal stabbing victim left to die in Adelaide street identified as 21yo William Holdback

image.altText: A woman named Fiona Bain walks along wearing dark sunglasses.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest into the death of Cleveland Dodd hears a nurse who was on duty the night the teenager self-harmed in his cell in Unit 18 describe the facility as being like a "war zone". WARNING: This story contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.

title.children: 'The staff were on the front line of a war': Nurse's diary exposes youth justice conditions

image.altText: A woman holding her shirt smiles at the a close up camera

props.synopsis: Abby Sturgess, 23, will spend at least six months in prison for fatally striking Norong cyclist Anthony Reeckman while distracted by social media on her mobile.

title.children: Young Victorian driver who hit and killed cyclist while using social media on her phone sentenced to jail

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman reads Where's Spot with an Aboriginal woman in a blue shirt.

props.synopsis: The Australian not-for-profit has bested authors, illustrators and organisations including Neil Gaiman and Quentin Blake to win a global award, in honour of the creator of Pippi Longstocking.

title.children: Australian charity beats Quentin Blake and Neil Gaiman to win $725,000 international literary award

image.altText: Karoline Dawe and Kylie Ward wearing nice evening dresses outside a gala event.

props.synopsis: The boss of a peak national nursing body is one of three executives who have been stood down pending an independent investigation into "potential financial irregularities" within the organisation.

title.children: Nursing executives stood down pending investigation of 'potential financial irregularities'

image.altText: A worker smooths concrete at slab pour at building construction site at Radar Street at Lytton at Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Queensland's premier has defended a deal brokered with construction unions that includes pay rises of more than $10 an hour over the next four years.

title.children: Queensland premier defends agreement that delivers union tradies pay rises of more than $10 per hour

image.altText: Annie Louey wears a brown suit and white shirt with brown buttons, she's smiling and standing in front of a pink wall

props.synopsis: It's Pay Day! Comedian Annie Louey explains how she spends 0 per cent of her income on rent or a mortgage, and why — despite growing up in a frugal home — she is in the habit of paying the bill instead of splitting it when she eats out.

title.children: Pay Day with Annie Louey: 'I'm still holding onto the car my parents bought 20 years ago'

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie carrying an umbrella surrounded by journalists

props.synopsis: Former Seven Network producer Taylor Auerbach's lawyer has made further submissions to the court in Bruce Lehrmann's defamation trial.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's 'silence was deafening' in response to new evidence, Taylor Auerbach's lawyer says

image.altText: An Australian female athletes holds the javelin next to her head as she prepares to throw.

props.synopsis: Track and field gold medallists in Paris will get $75,000 each from their governing body, World Athletics, with the organisation taking the $2.4 million from its share of Olympic revenue.

title.children: Paris Olympics track and field winners to share $3.6 million in prize money from World Athletics

image.altText: A crowd holding their phones in the air with the phone torches illuminated.

props.synopsis: Community leader Sissy Austin, who publicly shared her own experience of violence in bushland near Ballarat last year, has organised a rally against men's violence for Friday evening.

title.children: 'Snap rally' in Ballarat as many women 'in shock' after two alleged murders

image.altText: Roman Abramovich holds the Club World Cup trophy in one hand

props.synopsis: A complex web of money, Russian politics and English football is unravelling in the United Kingdom.

title.children: How an English football club got caught up in the aftermath of Russia's invasion of Ukraine

image.altText: An open cut mine under a cloudy sky

props.synopsis: Papua New Guinea's government approves a joint military and police operation to crack down on illegal mining and remove "squatters" at Porgera gold mine, just months after the site's grand reopening.

title.children: PNG's mega Porgera gold mine just reopened — so why is the government sending in police and military forces?

image.altText: A screenshot of someone being prompted to use the Palestinian flag emoji when they type the word Jerusalem into their iPhone.

props.synopsis: When iPhone users who have downloaded the latest software update type in the word "Jerusalem", they will see a prompt for the Palestinian flag emoji. Here's why that may have happened.

title.children: Why are some iPhone users seeing a Palestinian flag emoji when they type 'Jerusalem'?

image.altText: A Port Adelaide AFL player is hugged by a teammate (wearing #4) after kicking a goal.

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide forward Jeremy Finlayson has been found guilty of breaching the AFL's code of conduct and suspended for three matches for using a homophobic slur toward an Essendon player at Adelaide Oval on Friday night.

title.children: Power forward Finlayson banned for three games for 'very hurtful' homophobic slur

image.altText: British reality TV star Louise Thompson lying in a hospital bed with a hospital gown on

props.synopsis: Thompson, who has previously posted about having ulcerative colitis, says the stoma bag "represents life" and she does not want to hide it.

title.children: British reality TV star Louise Thompson praised for normalising stoma bags with 'brave' Instagram video

image.altText: A jail booking photo of Ethan Crumbley beside his mother Jennifer Crumbley and dad James Crumbley.

props.synopsis: In 2021,15-year-old Ethan Crumbley entered a Michigan school with a gun and started shooting. Now, his parents are going to jail for his actions. Here's how the events unfolded.

title.children: The parents of a school shooter have been jailed. Here's how it unfolded

image.altText: A man kisses the Israeli flag as protesters wave the Palestinian flag

props.synopsis: Penny Wong's decision to weigh into the fraught diplomatic argument over a two-state solution has prompted furious debate.

title.children: What does the government mean when it says it supports a two-state solution?
